Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Genetically Modified Mesenchymal Stromal Cells Overexpressing VEGF for Critical Limb Ischemia

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved MSCs overexpressing VEGF (MSC/VEGF), while the control group received unmodified MSCs.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the safety and efficacy of MSCs genetically modified to overexpress Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF-A165).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was angiogenesis, assessed using a Matrigel plug model over a 6-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 40 mice were randomised, with 20 receiving MSC/VEGF and 20 receiving unmodified MSCs.

Result_Outcome.evidence: MSC/VEGF demonstrated superior angiogenic potential compared to controls, with a significant increase in vascular structures (p < 0.05).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included mild to large intramuscular hematomas at the injection site in 15% of mice, with no systemic pathology observed.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by internal institutional grants.
